documentType: deposition transcript or expert consultation notes
summary: This document appears to be notes or a partial transcript from a November 8, 2021 WebEx meeting with Dr. Rocchio, likely a forensic psychologist or expert witness. The content focuses on a detailed review of psychological literature and expert opinions regarding delayed disclosure of childhood sexual abuse, grooming, memory, PTSD, and the reliability of victim testimony, specifically in the context of opposing expert reports from Dietz and Loftus in a civil CSA case.

persons.name: Dr. Rocchio
persons.context: Referred to as 'LR' throughout the document. Provides detailed expert analysis on delayed disclosure, grooming, memory, and PTSD in the context of childhood sexual abuse, specifically reviewing and critiquing the work of opposing experts Dietz and Loftus.

persons.name: Dietz
persons.context: An expert whose motion or report is being reviewed and critiqued by Dr. Rocchio. Rocchio disagrees with Dietz's interpretation of PTSD literature related to CSA.

persons.name: Loftus
persons.context: A memory researcher and opposing expert. Dr. Rocchio reviews her work, noting Loftus's research on false memories and arguing that the conditions for inducing false memories in labs may not be present in the specific case.

persons.name: Duron
persons.context: Author of an article that 'lays foundation for a discussion of coercive control,' cited by Dr. Rocchio.

persons.name: Alaggia
persons.context: Author of an article whose conclusions on delayed disclosure are reviewed by Dr. Rocchio.

persons.name: Carretta
persons.context: Cited for a study finding that 74% of people disclose abuse and 24% never tell anybody.

persons.name: Dworkin
persons.context: Author of an article providing a summary that PTSD is more closely associated with sexual abuse than any other trauma.

connections.description: Dr. Rocchio is reviewing and critiquing Dietz's expert motion/report, specifically disagreeing with Dietz's interpretation of PTSD literature.

Dr. Rocchio is reviewing Loftus's work on memory, noting they are opposing experts in another high-profile civil CSA case and arguing that Loftus's lab findings on false memory may not apply to the current case.

events.title: WebEx Consultation with Dr. Rocchio
events.description: A meeting or deposition where forensic psychologist Dr. Rocchio provides expert analysis on delayed disclosure, grooming, memory, and PTSD in the context of a childhood sexual abuse case, specifically reviewing the work of opposing experts Dietz and Loftus.

keyFacts: Dr. Rocchio, an expert witness, provides a detailed defense of the commonality and reasons for delayed disclosure of childhood sexual abuse, citing scientific and clinical literature.

The expert critiques opposing experts Dietz and Loftus, arguing against Dietz's interpretation of PTSD links to CSA and noting that Loftus's lab conditions for false memory may not be present in this case.
Key literature cited includes the 'betrayal trauma' theory, the Alaggia article on delayed disclosure, and the Dworkin article linking PTSD strongly to sexual abuse.

The document states that 'delayed disclosure comes up all the time in forensic practice' and that disclosure is a process, not a single event, with adolescents being among the least likely to disclose.
Dr. Rocchio works in both civil and criminal forensic practice, evaluating issues like delayed disclosure in CSA civil suits and battered women homicide cases.
